text: Q64. Consider Dijkstraâ€™s algorithm to determine single source shortest paths in a graph. The vertices of the graph is considered one by one. At each stage the next vertex considered is (a) One nearest the sources that has not yet been considered (b) One nearest the set of previously processed vertices that has not yet been considered (c) Both are true. The same vertex meets (vertices meet) these two [ejeteitates N (d) None of the above
